intro: Rubus potaninii, commonly known as the Potanin’s bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including countries like Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruits, which are edible, are similar to raspberries but have a more acidic flavor. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments.
